After obtaining informed consent, the patient was given a mirror and corroborated the location of the tumor prior to surgery. Moe's Micrographic Procedure, attention was turned toward the surgical site which was disinfected and cleansed with hibiclens. The patient was draped using a sterile technique, local anesthetic lidocaine 1% with epinephrine was infiltrated around the site. The procedure was performed in accordance um with the Moe's Micrographic surgical technique. The tumor site was debulked prior to the first Moe's stage, with each stage a thin layer of tissue was excised with a narrow margin of normal appearing skin using the Moe's fresh tissue technique, hemostasis was achieved hmm with pressure, the surgical site was dressed with gauze, pressure dressings, and the patient remained in the surgical area. The tissue was prepared for the cryostat and sectioned. Youth section was coated, cut, and stained for the microscopic examination.
